intro: Lightfootia ciliata var. major, commonly known as the large-fruited lightfootia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with ciliate margins, giving it its species name. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded habitats. The fruit is a capsule that releases small, hairy seeds when mature.
